intro: Spinacia turkestanica, commonly known as the Turkestan spinach, is a species of flowering plant in the amaranth family. It is native to Central Asia and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves that are edible. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and prefers well-drained soils. Its flowers are small and greenish-white, appearing in clusters. Spinacia turkestanica is valued for its nutritional content and is used in traditional cuisines across its native regions.
